Pre-Game Insights: Alex Cora switched up the pregame routine, cutting back on work for his players.
Brayan Bello will take the mound for the Red Sox.
The Red Sox responded with a 6-3 win over the Blue Jays, snapping a four-game losing streak.
The victory pulled the Red Sox to within four games of the Twins for the final wild-card spot with 30 games remaining.
Post-Match Reflections: Rafael Devers was out of the lineup due to shoulder soreness and is out again tonight.
Manager Alex Cora stated that if Devers needs two or three days to recover, they will take care of him.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brayan Bello has posted one win in his last seven starts.
Chris Bassitt is 2-0 with a 2.38 ERA in five career starts against the Red Sox, going at least six innings in all of them.
Abreu has 29 RBI in his last 38 games since July 9, batting.295 with a.974 OPS in that span.
In 34 games since the All-Star break, Masataka Yoshida has hit.336 with a.936 OPS.
